name: accounts
comment: This is an object that represents a Stripe account.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: country
columns.comment: The account's country.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: default_currency
columns.comment: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the default currency for the account. This must be a currency that [Stripe supports in the account's country](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts).

columns.name: details_submitted
columns.comment: Whether account details have been submitted. Standard accounts cannot receive payouts before this is true.

columns.name: email
columns.comment: The primary user's email address.

columns.name: payouts_enabled
columns.comment: Whether Stripe can send payouts to this account.

columns.name: charges_enabled
columns.comment: Whether the account can create live charges.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The type of the Stripe account. Can be `express` or `custom`.

columns.name: decline_charge_on_cvc_failure
columns.comment: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect CVC. This setting only applies when a CVC is provided and it fails bank verification.

columns.name: decline_charge_on_avs_failure
columns.comment: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect ZIP or postal code. This setting only applies when a ZIP or postal code is provided and they fail bank verification.

columns.name: legal_entity_business_name
columns.comment: The company's legal name.

columns.name: legal_entity_business_name_kana
columns.comment: The Kana variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_business_name_kanji
columns.comment: The Kanji variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_business_tax_id_provided
columns.comment: Whether the business ID number of the legal entity was provided.

columns.name: legal_entity_business_vat_id_provided
columns.comment: Whether the business VAT number of the legal entity was provided.

columns.name: legal_entity_first_name
columns.comment: The first name of the individual responsible for the account.

columns.name: legal_entity_first_name_kana
columns.comment: The Kana variation of the first name of the individual responsible for the account (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_first_name_kanji
columns.comment: The Kanji variation of the first name of the individual responsible for the account (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_gender
columns.comment: The gender of the individual responsible for the account (International regulations require either "male" or "female").

columns.name: legal_entity_last_name
columns.comment: The last name of the individual responsible for the account.

columns.name: legal_entity_last_name_kana
columns.comment: The Kana varation of the last name of the individual responsible for the account (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_last_name_kanji
columns.comment: The Kanji varation of the last name of the individual responsible for the account (Japan only).

columns.name: legal_entity_maiden_name
columns.comment: The maiden name of the individual responsible for the account.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_id_number_provided
columns.comment: Whether the personal ID number of the individual responsible for the account was provided.

columns.name: legal_entity_phone_number
columns.comment: The company's phone number, used for verification.

columns.name: legal_entity_ssn_last_4_provided
columns.comment: Whether the last 4 ssn digits of the individual responsible for the account have been provided.

columns.name: legal_entity_tax_id_registrar
columns.comment: The jurisdiction in which the `business_tax_id` is registered (Germany-based companies only).

columns.name: legal_entity_type
columns.comment: Either "individual" or "company", for what kind of legal entity the account owner is for.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_country
columns.comment: 2-letter country code.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: legal_entity_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: legal_entity_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_country
columns.comment: 2-letter country code.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kana_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_country
columns.comment: 2-letter country code.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: legal_entity_address_kanji_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: legal_entity_dob_day
columns.comment: The day of birth, between 1 and 31.

columns.name: legal_entity_dob_month
columns.comment: The month of birth, between 1 and 12.

columns.name: legal_entity_dob_year
columns.comment: The four-digit year of birth.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_country
columns.comment: 2-letter country code.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_country
columns.comment: 2-letter country code.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kana_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_country
columns.comment: 2-letter country code.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: legal_entity_personal_address_kanji_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: legal_entity_verification_details
columns.comment: A user-displayable string describing the verification state for the person. For example, this may say "Provided identity information could not be verified".

columns.name: legal_entity_verification_status
columns.comment: The state of verification for the person. Possible values are `unverified`, `pending`, or `verified`.

columns.name: payout_schedule_delay_days
columns.comment: The number of days charges for the account will be held before being paid out.

columns.name: payout_schedule_interval
columns.comment: How frequently funds will be paid out. One of `manual` (payouts only created via API call), `daily`, `weekly`, or `monthly`.

columns.name: payout_schedule_monthly_anchor
columns.comment: The day of the month funds will be paid out. Only shown if `interval` is monthly. Payouts scheduled between the 29th and 31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

columns.name: payout_schedule_weekly_anchor
columns.comment: The day of the week funds will be paid out, of the style 'monday', 'tuesday', etc. Only shown if `interval` is weekly.

columns.name: tos_acceptance_date
columns.comment: The Unix timestamp marking when the Stripe Services Agreement was accepted by the account representative

columns.name: tos_acceptance_ip
columns.comment: The IP address from which the Stripe Services Agreement was accepted by the account representative

columns.name: tos_acceptance_user_agent
columns.comment: The user agent of the browser from which the Stripe Services Agreement was accepted by the account representative

columns.name: verification_due_by
columns.comment: By what time the `fields_needed` must be provided. If this date is in the past, the account is already in bad standing, and providing `fields_needed` is necessary to re-enable payouts and prevent other consequences. If this date is in the future, `fields_needed` must be provided to ensure the account remains in good standing.

columns.name: verification_disabled_reason
columns.comment: If the account is disabled, this string describes why the account can’t create charges or receive payouts. Can be `rejected.fraud`, `rejected.terms_of_service`, `rejected.listed`, `rejected.other`, `fields_needed`, `listed`, `under_review`, or `other`.

name: accounts_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with accounts.

columns.name: account_id
columns.comment: The ID of the account that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: external_account_bank_accounts
comment: This is an object that represents an external bank account.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: account_holder_name
columns.comment: The name of the person or business that owns the bank account.

columns.name: account_holder_type
columns.comment: The type of entity that holds the account. This can be either `individual` or `company`.

columns.name: bank_name
columns.comment: Name of the bank associated with the routing number (e.g., `WELLS FARGO`).

columns.name: country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts) paid out to the bank account.

columns.name: default_for_currency
columns.comment: Whether this bank account is the default external account for its currency.

columns.name: fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

columns.name: routing_number
columns.comment: The routing transit number for the bank account.

columns.name: status
columns.comment:
For bank accounts, possible values are `new`, `validated`, `verified`, `verification_failed`, or `errored`. A bank account that hasn't had any activity or validation performed is `new`. If Stripe can determine that the bank account exists, its status will be `validated`. Note that there often isn’t enough information to know (e.g., for smaller credit unions), and the validation is not always run. If customer bank account verification has succeeded, the bank account status will be `verified`. If the verification failed for any reason, such as microdeposit failure, the status will be `verification_failed`. If a transfer sent to this bank account fails, we'll set the status to `errored` and will not continue to send transfers until the bank details are updated.

For external accounts, possible values are `new` and `errored`. Validations aren't run against external accounts because they're only used for payouts. This means the other statuses don't apply. If a transfer fails, the status is set to `errored` and transfers are stopped until account details are updated.

name: external_account_cards
comment: This is an object that represents an external account card.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: address_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: address_country
columns.comment: Billing address country, if provided when creating card.

columns.name: address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: address_line1_check
columns.comment: If `address_line1` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: address_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: address_zip
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: address_zip_check
columns.comment: If `address_zip` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: brand
columns.comment: Card brand. Can be `American Express`, `Diners Club`, `Discover`, `JCB`, `MasterCard`, `UnionPay`, `Visa`, or `Unknown`.

columns.name: country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you've collected.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for currency](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts). Only applicable on accounts (not customers or recipients). The card can be used as a transfer destination for funds in this currency.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The customer that this card belongs to. This attribute will not be in the card object if the card belongs to an account or recipient instead.

columns.name: cvc_check
columns.comment: If a CVC was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: default_for_currency
columns.comment: Whether this card is the default external account for its currency.

columns.name: dynamic_last4
columns.comment: (For tokenized numbers only.) The last four digits of the device account number.

columns.name: exp_month
columns.comment: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

columns.name: exp_year
columns.comment: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

columns.name: fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers who've signed up with you are using the same card number, for example.

columns.name: funding
columns.comment: Card funding type. Can be `credit`, `debit`, `prepaid`, or `unknown`.

columns.name: last4
columns.comment: The last four digits of the card.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: Cardholder name.

columns.name: recipient_id
columns.comment: The recipient that this card belongs to. This attribute will not be in the card object if the card belongs to a customer or account instead.

columns.name: tokenization_method
columns.comment: If the card number is tokenized, this is the method that was used. Can be `apple_pay` or `google_pay`.

columns.name: iin
columns.comment: The Issuer Identification Number or Bank Identification Number (BIN) of the card being used to make the payment. It is the first six digits of the card number.

name: application_fees
comment: When you collect a transaction fee on top of a charge made for your user (using Stripe Connect), an application fee object is created in your account.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: account_id
columns.comment: ID of the Stripe account this fee was taken from.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount earned, in cents.

columns.name: amount_refunded
columns.comment: Amount in cents refunded (can be less than the amount attribute on the fee if a partial refund was issued)

columns.name: application_id
columns.comment: ID of the Connect application that earned the fee.

columns.name: balance_transaction_id
columns.comment: Balance transaction that describes the impact of this collected application fee on your account balance (not including refunds).

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: ID of the charge that the application fee was taken from.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: originating_transaction_id
columns.comment: ID of the corresponding charge on the platform account, if this fee was the result of a charge using the `destination` parameter.

columns.name: refunded
columns.comment: Whether the fee has been fully refunded. If the fee is only partially refunded, this attribute will still be false.

name: balance_transactions
comment: This is an object representing transactions that contributed to your Stripe account balance.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Gross amount of the transaction, in cents.

columns.name: available_on
columns.comment: The date the transaction's net funds will become available in the Stripe balance.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: fee
columns.comment: Fees (in cents) paid for this transaction.

columns.name: net
columns.comment: Net amount of the transaction, in cents.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: If the transaction's net funds are available in the Stripe balance yet. Either `available` or `pending`.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: Transaction type: `adjustment`, `advance`, `advance_funding`, `application_fee`, `application_fee_refund`, `charge`, `connect_collection_transfer`, `issuing_authorization_hold`, `issuing_authorization_release`, `issuing_transaction`, `payment`, `payment_failure_refund`, `payment_refund`, `payout`, `payout_cancel`, `payout_failure`, `refund`, `refund_failure`, `reserve_transaction`, `reserved_funds`, `stripe_fee`, `stripe_fx_fee`, `tax_fee`, `topup`, `topup_reversal`, `transfer`, `transfer_cancel`, `transfer_failure`, or `transfer_refund`. [Learn more](https://stripe.com/docs/reports/balance-transaction-types) about balance transaction types and what they represent.

columns.name: source_id
columns.comment: The Stripe object to which this transaction is related.

columns.name: automatic_transfer_id
columns.comment: ID of the automatically created transfer associated with this balance transaction (only set if your account is on an [automatic payout schedule](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts#payout-schedule)).

columns.name: reporting_category
columns.comment: (Beta, subject to change) A new categorization of balance transactions, meant to improve on the current `type` field. [Learn more](https://stripe.com/docs/reports/reporting-categories). Please let us know what would be most helpful using the **Feedback** link at the bottom of this page.

name: balance_transaction_fee_details
comment: Detailed breakdown of fees (in cents) paid for this transaction.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount of the fee, in cents.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: Type of the fee, one of: `application_fee`, `stripe_fee` or `tax`.

name: charges
comment: To charge a credit or a debit card, you create a charge object.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: A positive integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](/docs/currencies#zero-decimal) (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or [equivalent in charge currency](/docs/currencies#minimum-and-maximum-charge-amounts). The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

columns.name: amount_refunded
columns.comment: Amount in cents refunded (can be less than the amount attribute on the charge if a partial refund was issued).

columns.name: application_fee_id
columns.comment: The application fee (if any) for the charge. [See the Connect documentation](/docs/connect/direct-charges#collecting-fees) for details.

columns.name: balance_transaction_id
columns.comment: ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this charge on your account balance (not including refunds or disputes).

columns.name: captured
columns.comment: If the charge was created without capturing, this Boolean represents whether it is still uncaptured or has since been captured.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: ID of the customer this charge is for if one exists.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: dispute_id
columns.comment: Details about the dispute if the charge has been disputed.

columns.name: failure_code
columns.comment: Error code explaining reason for charge failure if available (see [the errors section](/docs/api#errors) for a list of codes).

columns.name: failure_message
columns.comment: Message to user further explaining reason for charge failure if available.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: ID of the invoice this charge is for if one exists.

columns.name: order_id
columns.comment: ID of the order this charge is for if one exists.

columns.name: paid
columns.comment: `true` if the charge succeeded, or was successfully authorized for later capture.

columns.name: receipt_email
columns.comment: This is the email address that the receipt for this charge was sent to.

columns.name: receipt_number
columns.comment: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this charge. This attribute will be `null` until a receipt has been sent.

columns.name: refunded
columns.comment: Whether the charge has been fully refunded. If the charge is only partially refunded, this attribute will still be false.

columns.name: statement_descriptor
columns.comment: For card charges, use `statement_descriptor_suffix` instead. Otherwise, you can use this value as the complete description of a charge on your customers’ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The status of the payment is either `succeeded`, `pending`, or `failed`.

columns.name: source_transfer_id
columns.comment: The transfer ID which created this charge. Only present if the charge came from another Stripe account. [See the Connect documentation](/docs/connect/destination-charges) for details.

columns.name: transfer_id
columns.comment: ID of the transfer to the `destination` account (only applicable if the charge was created using the `destination` parameter).

columns.name: transfer_group
columns.comment: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. See the [Connect documentation](/docs/connect/charges-transfers#grouping-transactions) for details.

columns.name: application_id
columns.comment: ID of the Connect application that created the charge.

columns.name: card_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: card_address_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: card_address_country
columns.comment: Billing address country, if provided when creating card.

columns.name: card_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: card_address_line1_check
columns.comment: If `address_line1` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: card_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: card_address_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: card_address_zip
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: card_address_zip_check
columns.comment: If `address_zip` was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: card_brand
columns.comment: Card brand. Can be `American Express`, `Diners Club`, `Discover`, `JCB`, `MasterCard`, `UnionPay`, `Visa`, or `Unknown`.

columns.name: card_country
columns.comment: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card. You could use this attribute to get a sense of the international breakdown of cards you've collected.

columns.name: card_currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for currency](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts). Only applicable on accounts (not customers or recipients). The card can be used as a transfer destination for funds in this currency.

columns.name: card_customer_id
columns.comment: The customer that this card belongs to. This attribute will not be in the card object if the card belongs to an account or recipient instead.

columns.name: card_cvc_check
columns.comment: If a CVC was provided, results of the check: `pass`, `fail`, `unavailable`, or `unchecked`.

columns.name: card_dynamic_last4
columns.comment: (For tokenized numbers only.) The last four digits of the device account number.

columns.name: card_exp_month
columns.comment: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

columns.name: card_exp_year
columns.comment: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

columns.name: card_fingerprint
columns.comment: Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this attribute to check whether two customers who've signed up with you are using the same card number, for example.

columns.name: card_funding
columns.comment: Card funding type. Can be `credit`, `debit`, `prepaid`, or `unknown`.

columns.name: card_last4
columns.comment: The last four digits of the card.

columns.name: card_name
columns.comment: Cardholder name.

columns.name: card_recipient_id
columns.comment: The recipient that this card belongs to. This attribute will not be in the card object if the card belongs to a customer or account instead.

columns.name: card_tokenization_method
columns.comment: If the card number is tokenized, this is the method that was used. Can be `apple_pay` or `google_pay`.

columns.name: card_iin
columns.comment: The Issuer Identification Number or Bank Identification Number (BIN) of the card being used to make the payment. It is the first six digits of the card number.

columns.name: card_default_for_currency
columns.comment: Only applicable on payout external account card belonging to merchant (not as payment source customer card in charge).

columns.name: outcome_network_status
columns.comment: Possible values are `approved_by_network`, `declined_by_network`, `not_sent_to_network`, and `reversed_after_approval`. The value `reversed_after_approval` indicates the payment was [blocked by Stripe](/docs/declines#blocked-payments) after bank authorization, and may temporarily appear as "pending" on a cardholder's statement.

columns.name: outcome_reason
columns.comment: An enumerated value providing a more detailed explanation of the outcome's `type`. Charges blocked by Radar's default block rule have the value `highest_risk_level`. Charges placed in review by Radar's default review rule have the value `elevated_risk_level`. Charges authorized, blocked, or placed in review by custom rules have the value `rule`. See [understanding declines](/docs/declines) for more details.

columns.name: outcome_rule_id
columns.comment: The ID of the Radar rule that matched the payment, if applicable.

columns.name: outcome_type
columns.comment: Possible values are `authorized`, `manual_review`, `issuer_declined`, `blocked`, and `invalid`. See [understanding declines](/docs/declines) and [Radar reviews](radar/review) for details.

columns.name: outcome_seller_message
columns.comment: A human-readable description of the outcome type and reason, designed for you (the recipient of the payment), not your customer.

columns.name: outcome_risk_level
columns.comment: Stripe's evaluation of the riskiness of the payment. Possible values for evaluated payments are `normal`, `elevated`, `highest`. For non-card payments, and card-based payments predating the public assignment of risk levels, this field will have the value `not_assessed`. In the event of an error in the evaluation, this field will have the value `unknown`.

columns.name: outcome_risk_score
columns.comment: Stripe's evaluation of the riskiness of the payment. Possible values for evaluated payments are between 0 and 100. For non-card payments, card-based payments predating the public assignment of risk scores, or in the event of an error during evaluation, this field will not be present. This field is only available with Radar for Fraud Teams.

name: charges_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with charges.

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: The ID of the charge that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: coupons
comment: A coupon contains information about a percent-off or amount-off discount you might want to apply to a customer. Coupons only apply to invoices; they do not apply to one-off charges.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount_off
columns.comment: Amount (in the `currency` specified) that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: If `amount_off` has been set, the three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies) of the amount to take off.

columns.name: duration
columns.comment: One of `forever`, `once`, and `repeating`. Describes how long a customer who applies this coupon will get the discount.

columns.name: duration_in_months
columns.comment: If `duration` is `repeating`, the number of months the coupon applies. Null if coupon `duration` is `forever` or `once`.

columns.name: max_redemptions
columns.comment: Maximum number of times this coupon can be redeemed, in total, across all customers, before it is no longer valid.

columns.name: percent_off
columns.comment: Percent that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer for the duration of the coupon. For example, a coupon with percent_off of 50 will make a $100 invoice $50 instead.

columns.name: redeem_by
columns.comment: Date after which the coupon can no longer be redeemed.

columns.name: times_redeemed
columns.comment: Number of times this coupon has been applied to a customer.

columns.name: valid
columns.comment: Taking account of the above properties, whether this coupon can still be applied to a customer.

name: coupons_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with coupons.

columns.name: coupon_id
columns.comment: The ID of the coupon that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: credit_notes
comment: Credit notes are documents that decrease the amount owed on invoices.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: The integer amount in **cents** representing the total amount of the credit note, including tax.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: ID of the customer.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: ID of the invoice.

columns.name: memo
columns.comment: Customer-facing text that appears on the credit note PDF.

columns.name: number
columns.comment: A unique number that identifies this particular credit note and appears on the PDF of the credit note and its associated invoice.

columns.name: reason
columns.comment: Reason for issuing this credit note, one of `duplicate`, `fraudulent`, `order_change`, or `product_unsatisfactory`

columns.name: refund_id
columns.comment: Refund related to this credit note.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: Status of this credit note, one of `issued` or `void`. Learn more about [voiding credit notes](/docs/billing/invoices/credit-notes#voiding).

columns.name: type
columns.comment: Type of this credit note, one of `post_payment` or `pre_payment`. A `pre_payment` credit note means it was issued when the invoice was open. A `post_payment` credit note means it was issued when the invoice was paid.

name: credit_notes_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with credit notes.

columns.name: credit_note_id
columns.comment: The ID of the credit_note that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: credit_note_line_items
comment: Credit note line items

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: The integer amount in **cents** representing the gross amount being credited for this line item, excluding (exclusive) tax and discounts.

columns.name: discount
columns.comment: The integer amount in **cents** representing the discount being credited for this line item.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: Description of the item being credited.

columns.name: quantity
columns.comment: The number of units of product being credited.

columns.name: unit_amount
columns.comment: The cost of each unit of product being credited.

name: credit_note_line_item_tax_amounts
comment: Tax amounts for credit note line items

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: The amount, in cents, of the tax.

columns.name: inclusive
columns.comment: Whether this tax amount is inclusive or exclusive.

columns.name: tax_rate_id
columns.comment: The tax rate that was applied to get this tax amount.

name: customers
comment: Customer objects allow you to perform recurring charges and track multiple charges that are associated with the same customer.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: account_balance
columns.comment: This field has been renamed to `balance` and will be removed in a future API version.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies) the customer can be charged in for recurring billing purposes.

columns.name: delinquent
columns.comment: When the customer's latest invoice is billed by charging automatically, delinquent is true if the invoice's latest charge is failed. When the customer's latest invoice is billed by sending an invoice, delinquent is true if the invoice is not paid by its due date.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: email
columns.comment: The customer's email address.

columns.name: default_source_id
columns.comment: ID of the default payment source for the customer.

columns.name: shipping_name
columns.comment: Customer name.

columns.name: shipping_phone
columns.comment: Customer phone (including extension).

columns.name: shipping_address_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: shipping_address_country
columns.comment: 2-letter country code.

columns.name: shipping_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: shipping_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: shipping_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: shipping_address_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: discount_coupon_id
columns.comment: Hash describing the coupon applied to create this discount.

columns.name: discount_end
columns.comment: If the coupon has a duration of `repeating`, the date that this discount will end. If the coupon has a duration of `once` or `forever`, this attribute will be null.

columns.name: discount_start
columns.comment: Date that the coupon was applied.

columns.name: discount_subscription
columns.comment: The subscription that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription.

columns.name: tax_info_tax_id
columns.comment: The customer's tax ID number.

columns.name: tax_info_type
columns.comment: The type of ID number.

name: customers_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with customers.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the customer that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: disputes
comment: A dispute occurs when a customer questions your charge with their bank or credit card company.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Disputed amount. Usually the amount of the charge, but can differ (usually because of currency fluctuation or because only part of the order is disputed).

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: ID of the charge that was disputed.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: is_charge_refundable
columns.comment: If true, it is still possible to refund the disputed payment. Once the payment has been fully refunded, no further funds will be withdrawn from your Stripe account as a result of this dispute.

columns.name: reason
columns.comment: Reason given by cardholder for dispute. Possible values are `bank_cannot_process`, `check_returned`, `credit_not_processed`, `customer_initiated`, `debit_not_authorized`, `duplicate`, `fraudulent`, `general`, `incorrect_account_details`, `insufficient_funds`, `product_not_received`, `product_unacceptable`, `subscription_canceled`, or `unrecognized`. Read more about [dispute reasons](/docs/disputes/categories).

columns.name: status
columns.comment: Current status of dispute. Possible values are `warning_needs_response`, `warning_under_review`, `warning_closed`, `needs_response`, `under_review`, `charge_refunded`, `won`, or `lost`.

columns.name: evidence_access_activity_log
columns.comment: Any server or activity logs showing proof that the customer accessed or downloaded the purchased digital product. This information should include IP addresses, corresponding timestamps, and any detailed recorded activity.

columns.name: evidence_billing_address
columns.comment: The billing address provided by the customer.

columns.name: evidence_cancellation_policy_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Your subscription cancellation policy, as shown to the customer.

columns.name: evidence_cancellation_policy_disclosure
columns.comment: An explanation of how and when the customer was shown your refund policy prior to purchase.

columns.name: evidence_cancellation_rebuttal
columns.comment: A justification for why the customer's subscription was not canceled.

columns.name: evidence_customer_communication_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Any communication with the customer that you feel is relevant to your case. Examples include emails proving that the customer received the product or service, or demonstrating their use of or satisfaction with the product or service.

columns.name: evidence_customer_email_address
columns.comment: The email address of the customer.

columns.name: evidence_customer_name
columns.comment: The name of the customer.

columns.name: evidence_customer_purchase_ip
columns.comment: The IP address that the customer used when making the purchase.

columns.name: evidence_customer_signature_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) A relevant document or contract showing the customer's signature.

columns.name: evidence_duplicate_charge_documentation_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Documentation for the prior charge that can uniquely identify the charge, such as a receipt, shipping label, work order, etc. This document should be paired with a similar document from the disputed payment that proves the two payments are separate.

columns.name: evidence_duplicate_charge_id
columns.comment: The Stripe ID for the prior charge which appears to be a duplicate of the disputed charge.

columns.name: evidence_product_description
columns.comment: A description of the product or service that was sold.

columns.name: evidence_receipt_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Any receipt or message sent to the customer notifying them of the charge.

columns.name: evidence_refund_policy_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Your refund policy, as shown to the customer.

columns.name: evidence_refund_policy_disclosure
columns.comment: Documentation demonstrating that the customer was shown your refund policy prior to purchase.

columns.name: evidence_refund_refusal_explanation
columns.comment: A justification for why the customer is not entitled to a refund.

columns.name: evidence_service_date
columns.comment: The date on which the customer received or began receiving the purchased service, in a clear human-readable format.

columns.name: evidence_service_documentation_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Documentation showing proof that a service was provided to the customer. This could include a copy of a signed contract, work order, or other form of written agreement.

columns.name: evidence_shipping_address
columns.comment: The address to which a physical product was shipped. You should try to include as complete address information as possible.

columns.name: evidence_shipping_carrier
columns.comment: The delivery service that shipped a physical product, such as Fedex, UPS, USPS, etc. If multiple carriers were used for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

columns.name: evidence_shipping_date
columns.comment: The date on which a physical product began its route to the shipping address, in a clear human-readable format.

columns.name: evidence_shipping_documentation_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Documentation showing proof that a product was shipped to the customer at the same address the customer provided to you. This could include a copy of the shipment receipt, shipping label, etc. It should show the customer's full shipping address, if possible.

columns.name: evidence_shipping_tracking_number
columns.comment: The tracking number for a physical product, obtained from the delivery service. If multiple tracking numbers were generated for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

columns.name: evidence_uncategorized_file_id
columns.comment: (ID of a [file upload](https://stripe.com/docs/guides/file-upload)) Any additional evidence or statements.

columns.name: evidence_uncategorized_text
columns.comment: Any additional evidence or statements.

columns.name: evidence_details_due_by
columns.comment: Date by which evidence must be submitted in order to successfully challenge dispute. Will be null if the customer's bank or credit card company doesn't allow a response for this particular dispute.

columns.name: evidence_details_has_evidence
columns.comment: Whether evidence has been staged for this dispute.

columns.name: evidence_details_past_due
columns.comment: Whether the last evidence submission was submitted past the due date. Defaults to `false` if no evidence submissions have occurred. If `true`, then delivery of the latest evidence is *not* guaranteed.

columns.name: evidence_details_submission_count
columns.comment: The number of times evidence has been submitted. Typically, you may only submit evidence once.

name: disputes_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with disputes.

columns.name: dispute_id
columns.comment: The ID of the dispute that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: early_fraud_warnings
comment: An early fraud warning indicates that the card issuer has notified us that a charge may be fraudulent.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: ID of the charge this early fraud warning is for, optionally expanded.

columns.name: fraud_type
columns.comment: The type of fraud labelled by the issuer. One of `card_never_received`, `fraudulent_card_application`, `made_with_counterfeit_card`, `made_with_lost_card`, `made_with_stolen_card`, `misc`, `unauthorized_use_of_card`.

columns.name: actionable
columns.comment: An EFW is actionable if it has not received a dispute and has not been fully refunded. You may wish to proactively refund a charge that receives an EFW, in order to avoid receiving a dispute later.

name: application_fee_refunds
comment: Application Fee Refund objects allow you to refund an application fee that has previously been created but not yet refunded. Funds will be refunded to the Stripe account that the fee was originally collected from.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount, in cents.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: fee_id
columns.comment: ID of the application fee that was refunded.

columns.name: balance_transaction_id
columns.comment: Balance transaction that describes the impact on your account balance.

name: application_fee_refunds_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with application fee refunds.

columns.name: application_fee_refund_id
columns.comment: The ID of the application_fee_refund that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: invoices
comment: Invoices are statements of what a customer owes for a particular billing period, including subscriptions, invoice items, and any automatic proration adjustments if necessary.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount_due
columns.comment: Final amount due at this time for this invoice. If the invoice's total is smaller than the minimum charge amount, for example, or if there is account credit that can be applied to the invoice, the `amount_due` may be 0. If there is a positive `starting_balance` for the invoice (the customer owes money), the `amount_due` will also take that into account. The charge that gets generated for the invoice will be for the amount specified in `amount_due`.

columns.name: attempt_count
columns.comment: Number of payment attempts made for this invoice, from the perspective of the payment retry schedule. Any payment attempt counts as the first attempt, and subsequently only automatic retries increment the attempt count. In other words, manual payment attempts after the first attempt do not affect the retry schedule.

columns.name: attempted
columns.comment: Whether an attempt has been made to pay the invoice. An invoice is not attempted until 1 hour after the `invoice.created` webhook, for example, so you might not want to display that invoice as unpaid to your users.

columns.name: auto_advance
columns.comment: Controls whether Stripe will perform [automatic collection](/docs/billing/invoices/workflow/#auto_advance) of the invoice. When `false`, the invoice's state will not automatically advance without an explicit action.

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: ID of the latest charge generated for this invoice, if any.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. Referenced as 'memo' in the Dashboard.

columns.name: ending_balance
columns.comment: Ending customer balance after the invoice is finalized. Invoices are finalized approximately an hour after successful webhook delivery or when payment collection is attempted for the invoice. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be null.

columns.name: next_payment_attempt
columns.comment: The time at which payment will next be attempted. This value will be `null` for invoices where `collection_method=send_invoice`.

columns.name: number
columns.comment: A unique, identifying string that appears on emails sent to the customer for this invoice. This starts with the customer's unique invoice_prefix if it is specified.

columns.name: paid
columns.comment: Whether payment was successfully collected for this invoice. An invoice can be paid (most commonly) with a charge or with credit from the customer's account balance.

columns.name: period_end
columns.comment: End of the usage period during which invoice items were added to this invoice.

columns.name: period_start
columns.comment: Start of the usage period during which invoice items were added to this invoice.

columns.name: receipt_number
columns.comment: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this invoice.

columns.name: starting_balance
columns.comment: Starting customer balance before the invoice is finalized. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be the current customer balance.

columns.name: statement_descriptor
columns.comment: Extra information about an invoice for the customer's credit card statement.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The status of the invoice, one of `draft`, `open`, `paid`, `uncollectible`, or `void`. [Learn more](/docs/billing/invoices/workflow#workflow-overview)

columns.name: subscription_id
columns.comment: The subscription that this invoice was prepared for, if any.

columns.name: subscription_proration_date
columns.comment: Only set for upcoming invoices that preview prorations. The time used to calculate prorations.

columns.name: subtotal
columns.comment: Total of all subscriptions, invoice items, and prorations on the invoice before any discount or tax is applied.

columns.name: tax
columns.comment: The amount of tax on this invoice. This is the sum of all the tax amounts on this invoice.

columns.name: total
columns.comment: Total after discounts and taxes.

columns.name: webhooks_delivered_at
columns.comment: The time at which webhooks for this invoice were successfully delivered (if the invoice had no webhooks to deliver, this will match `created`). Invoice payment is delayed until webhooks are delivered, or until all webhook delivery attempts have been exhausted.

columns.name: discount_coupon_id
columns.comment: Hash describing the coupon applied to create this discount.

columns.name: discount_end
columns.comment: If the coupon has a duration of `repeating`, the date that this discount will end. If the coupon has a duration of `once` or `forever`, this attribute will be null.

columns.name: discount_start
columns.comment: Date that the coupon was applied.

columns.name: discount_subscription
columns.comment: The subscription that this coupon is applied to, if it is applied to a particular subscription.

columns.name: status_transitions_finalized_at
columns.comment: The time that the invoice draft was finalized.

columns.name: status_transitions_marked_uncollectible_at
columns.comment: The time that the invoice was marked uncollectible.

columns.name: status_transitions_paid_at
columns.comment: The time that the invoice was paid.

columns.name: status_transitions_voided_at
columns.comment: The time that the invoice was voided.

name: invoices_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with invoices.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: The ID of the invoice that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: invoice_line_items
comment: Subscription invoice items become invoice line items when they are charged to a customer.

columns.name: source_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: The amount, in cents.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: discountable
columns.comment: If true, discounts will apply to this line item. Always false for prorations.

columns.name: plan_id
columns.comment: The plan of the subscription, if the line item is a subscription or a proration.

columns.name: proration
columns.comment: Whether this is a proration.

columns.name: quantity
columns.comment: The quantity of the subscription, if the line item is a subscription or a proration.

columns.name: subscription
columns.comment: The subscription that the invoice item pertains to, if any.

columns.name: source_type
columns.comment: A string identifying the type of the source of this line item, either an `invoiceitem` or a `subscription`.

columns.name: period_start
columns.comment: Start of the line item's billing period

columns.name: period_end
columns.comment: End of the line item's billing period

name: invoice_items
comment: Subscription invoice items allow you to add a charge or credit to a customer but only actually charge the customer's card at the end of a regular billing cycle.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount (in the `currency` specified) of the invoice item. This should always be equal to `unit_amount * quantity`.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: customer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the customer who will be billed when this invoice item is billed.

columns.name: date
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

columns.name: discountable
columns.comment: If true, discounts will apply to this invoice item. Always false for prorations.

columns.name: invoice_id
columns.comment: The ID of the invoice this invoice item belongs to.

columns.name: plan_id
columns.comment: If the invoice item is a proration, the plan of the subscription that the proration was computed for.

columns.name: proration
columns.comment: Whether the invoice item was created automatically as a proration adjustment when the customer switched plans.

columns.name: quantity
columns.comment: Quantity of units for the invoice item. If the invoice item is a proration, the quantity of the subscription that the proration was computed for.

columns.name: subscription_id
columns.comment: The subscription that this invoice item has been created for, if any.

columns.name: unit_amount
columns.comment: Unit Amount (in the `currency` specified) of the invoice item.

columns.name: period_start
columns.comment: Start of the line item's billing period

columns.name: period_end
columns.comment: End of the line item's billing period

name: invoice_items_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with invoice items.

columns.name: invoice_item_id
columns.comment: The ID of the invoice_item that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: transfers
comment: A transfer object is created when you receive funds from Stripe or you initiate a transfer to either a bank account or debit card of a connected Stripe account.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount (in cents) to be transferred to your bank account.

columns.name: amount_reversed
columns.comment: Amount in cents reversed (can be less than the amount attribute on the transfer if a partial reversal was issued).

columns.name: automatic
columns.comment: Returns `true` if the payout was created by an [automated payout schedule](/docs/payouts#payout-schedule), and `false` if it was [requested manually](https://stripe.com/docs/payouts#manual-payouts).

columns.name: balance_transaction_id
columns.comment: Balance transaction that describes the impact of this transfer on your account balance.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: date
columns.comment: Date the transfer is scheduled to arrive in the bank. This factors in delays like weekends or bank holidays.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: Internal-only description of the transfer.

columns.name: destination_id
columns.comment: ID of the bank account, card, or Stripe account the transfer was sent to.

columns.name: destination_payment_id
columns.comment: If the destination is a Stripe account, this will be the ID of the payment that the destination account received for the transfer.

columns.name: failure_code
columns.comment: Error code explaining reason for transfer failure if available. See [Types of transfer failures](/docs/api#transfer_failures) for a list of failure codes.

columns.name: failure_message
columns.comment: Message to user further explaining reason for transfer failure if available.

columns.name: reversed
columns.comment: Whether the transfer has been fully reversed. If the transfer is only partially reversed, this attribute will still be false.

columns.name: source_transaction_id
columns.comment: ID of the charge (or other transaction) that was used to fund the transfer. If null, the transfer was funded from the available balance.

columns.name: source_type
columns.comment: The source balance this transfer came from. One of `card` or `bank_account`.

columns.name: statement_descriptor
columns.comment: Extra information about a transfer to be displayed on the user's bank statement.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: Current status of the transfer (`paid`, `pending`, `in_transit`, `canceled` or `failed`). A transfer will be `pending` until it is submitted to the bank, at which point it becomes `in_transit`. It will then change to `paid` if the transaction goes through. If it does not go through successfully, its status will change to `failed` or `canceled`.

columns.name: transfer_group
columns.comment: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. See the [Connect documentation](/docs/connect/charges-transfers#grouping-transactions) for details.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: Can be `card`, `bank_account`, or `stripe_account`.

name: transfers_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with transfers.

columns.name: transfer_id
columns.comment: The ID of the transfer that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: plans
comment: A subscription plan contains the pricing information for different products and feature levels on your site.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: The amount in cents to be charged on the interval specified.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: interval
columns.comment: One of `day`, `week`, `month` or `year`. The frequency with which a subscription should be billed.

columns.name: interval_count
columns.comment: The number of intervals (specified in the `interval` property) between subscription billings. For example, `interval=month` and `interval_count=3` bills every 3 months.

columns.name: nickname
columns.comment: A brief description of the plan, hidden from customers.

columns.name: product_id
columns.comment: The product whose pricing this plan determines.

columns.name: trial_period_days
columns.comment: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this plan using [`trial_from_plan=true`](/docs/api#create_subscription-trial_from_plan).

name: plans_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with plans.

columns.name: plan_id
columns.comment: The ID of the plan that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: products
comment: Products may be physical goods or services.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: active
columns.comment: Whether the product is currently available for purchase.

columns.name: caption
columns.comment: A short one-line description of the product, meant to be displayable to the customer. Only applicable to products of `type=good`.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: deactivate_on
columns.comment: An array of connect application identifiers that cannot purchase this product. Only applicable to products of `type=good`.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: The product's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Only applicable to products of `type=good`.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The product's name, meant to be displayable to the customer. Applicable to both `service` and `good` types.

columns.name: shippable
columns.comment: Whether this product is a shipped good. Only applicable to products of `type=good`.

columns.name: statement_descriptor
columns.comment: Extra information about a product which will appear on your customer's credit card statement. In the case that multiple products are billed at once, the first statement descriptor will be used. Only available on products of type=`service`.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The type of the product. The product is either of type `good`, which is eligible for use with Orders and SKUs, or `service`, which is eligible for use with Subscriptions and Plans.

columns.name: unit_label
columns.comment: A label that represents units of this product, such as seat(s), in Stripe and on customers’ receipts and invoices. Only available on products of type=`service`.

columns.name: url
columns.comment: A URL of a publicly-accessible webpage for this product. Only applicable to products of `type=good`.

name: products_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with products.

columns.name: product_id
columns.comment: The ID of the product that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: refunds
comment: Refund objects allow you to refund a charge that has previously been created but not yet refunded.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: Amount, in cents.

columns.name: balance_transaction_id
columns.comment: Balance transaction that describes the impact on your account balance.

columns.name: charge_id
columns.comment: ID of the charge that was refunded.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

columns.name: reason
columns.comment: Reason for the refund. If set, possible values are `duplicate`, `fraudulent`, and `requested_by_customer`.

columns.name: receipt_number
columns.comment: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this refund.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: Status of the refund. For credit card refunds, this can be `pending`, `succeeded`, or `failed`. For other types of refunds, it can be `pending`, `succeeded`, `failed`, or `canceled`. Refer to our [refunds](/docs/refunds#failed-refunds) documentation for more details.

columns.name: failure_reason
columns.comment: If the refund failed, the reason for refund failure if known. Possible values are `lost_or_stolen_card`, `expired_or_canceled_card`, or `unknown`.

name: refunds_metadata
comment: Additional metadata fields associated with refunds.

columns.name: refund_id
columns.comment: The ID of the refund that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.name: key
columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Value of the metadata.

name: sources
comment: Source objects allow you to accept a variety of payment methods.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the object.

columns.name: amount
columns.comment: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (that is, 100 cents for $1.00, or 1 for ¥1, Japanese Yen being a zero-decimal currency) representing the total amount associated with the source. This is the amount for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for `single_use` sources.

columns.name: client_secret
columns.comment: The client secret of the source. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: currency
columns.comment: Three-letter [ISO code for the currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies) associated with the source. This is the currency for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for `single_use` sources.

columns.name: flow
columns.comment: The authentication `flow` of the source. `flow` is one of `redirect`, `receiver`, `code_verification`, `none`.

columns.name: status
columns.comment: The status of the source, one of `canceled`, `chargeable`, `consumed`, `failed`, or `pending`. Only `chargeable` sources can be used to create a charge.

columns.name: type
columns.comment: The `type` of the source. The `type` is a payment method, one of `ach_credit_transfer`, `ach_debit`, `alipay`, `bancontact`, `card`, `card_present`, `eps`, `giropay`, `ideal`, `multibanco`, `klarna`, `p24`, `sepa_debit`, `sofort`, `three_d_secure`, or `wechat`. An additional hash is included on the source with a name matching this value. It contains additional information specific to the [payment method](/docs/sources) used.

columns.name: usage
columns.comment: Either `reusable` or `single_use`. Whether this source should be reusable or not. Some source types may or may not be reusable by construction, while others may leave the option at creation. If an incompatible value is passed, an error will be returned.

columns.name: code_verification_attempts_remaining
columns.comment: The number of attempts remaining to authenticate the source object with a verification code.

columns.name: code_verification_status
columns.comment: The status of the code verification, either `pending` (awaiting verification, `attempts_remaining` should be greater than 0), `succeeded` (successful verification) or `failed` (failed verification, cannot be verified anymore as `attempts_remaining` should be 0).

columns.name: owner_email
columns.comment: Owner's email address.

columns.name: owner_name
columns.comment: Owner's full name.

columns.name: owner_phone
columns.comment: Owner's phone number (including extension).

columns.name: owner_verified_email
columns.comment: Verified owner's email address. Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

columns.name: owner_verified_name
columns.comment: Verified owner's full name. Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

columns.name: owner_verified_phone
columns.comment: Verified owner's phone number (including extension). Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

columns.name: owner_address_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: owner_address_country
columns.comment: 2-letter country code.

columns.name: owner_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: owner_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: owner_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: owner_address_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: owner_verified_address_city
columns.comment: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

columns.name: owner_verified_address_country
columns.comment: 2-letter country code.

columns.name: owner_verified_address_line1
columns.comment: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

columns.name: owner_verified_address_line2
columns.comment: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

columns.name: owner_verified_address_postal_code
columns.comment: ZIP or postal code.

columns.name: owner_verified_address_state
columns.comment: State/County/Province/Region.

columns.name: receiver_address
columns.comment: The address of the receiver source. This is the value that should be communicated to the customer to send their funds to.

columns.name: receiver_amount_charged
columns.comment: The total amount that was charged by you. The amount charged is expressed in the source's currency.

columns.name: receiver_amount_received
columns.comment: The total amount received by the receiver source. `amount_received = amount_returned + amount_charged` is true at all time. The amount received is expressed in the source's currency.

columns.name: receiver_amount_returned
columns.comment: The total amount that was returned to the customer. The amount returned is expressed in the source's currency.

columns.name: redirect_return_url
columns.comment: The URL you provide to redirect the customer to after they authenticated their payment.

columns.name: redirect_status
columns.comment: The status of the redirect, either `pending` (ready to be used by your customer to authenticate the transaction), `succeeded` (succesful authentication, cannot be reused) or `not_required` (redirect should not be used) or `failed` (failed authentication, cannot be reused).

columns.name: redirect_url
columns.comment: The URL provided to you to redirect a customer to as part of a `redirect` authentication flow.

columns.name: redirect_failure_reason
columns.comment: The failure reason for the redirect, either `user_abort` (the customer aborted or dropped out of the redirect flow), `declined` (the authentication failed or the transaction was declined), or `processing_error` (the redirect failed due to a technical error). Present only if the redirect status is `failed`.

comment: Additional metadata fields associated with sources.

columns.comment: The ID of the source that this metadata entry is associated with.

columns.comment: Name of the metadata key.
